title: References
text:
We would like to express our gratitude to the following resources, which have been essential in shaping this online guide. We recommend these references for further reading:


Australian Research Data Commons. 2021. “How Can Software Containers Help Your Research?” https://doi.org/10.5281/ZENODO.5091260. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HelrQnm3v4g. License: CC BY 4.0.


Eyers, D. M., S. L. R. Stevens, A. Turner, C. Koch, and J. Cohen. 2020. “Reproducible Computational Environments Using Containers: Introduction to Docker.” Carpentries Incubator. https://github.com/carpentries-incubator/docker-introduction. Version 2020.09a (4a93bd67aa). License: Instructional Material: CC BY 4.0; Software: MIT.


The Turing Way Community. 2022. “Containers.” In The Turing Way: A Handbook for Reproducible, Ethical and Collaborative Research. Zenodo. https://doi.org/10.5281/ZENODO.7625728. https://the-turing-way.netlify.app/reproducible-research/renv/renv-containers.html. License: CC BY 4.0.
